definition[0]: used to introduce a statement that makes the main statement coming after it seem surprising, unlikely, or unexpected
example[0]: Though she’s almost 40, she still plans to compete.
example[1]: Pascal went ahead with the experiment even though he knew it was dangerous.
example[2]: The rooms, though small, were pleasant and airy.
example[3]: Strange though it may seem, I like housework.
note[1]: old though it is/tired though he was etc
definition[1]: used like ‘but’ to add a fact or opinion that makes what you have just said seem less definite, less important etc
example[4]: I thought he’d been drinking, though I wasn’t completely sure.
example[5]: The offenders were dealt with firmly though fairly.
definition[2]: used after adding a fact, opinion, or question which seems surprising after what you have just said, or which makes what you have just said seem less true
example[6]: Two heart attacks in a year. It hasn’t stopped him smoking, though.
example[7]: It sounds like a lot of fun. Isn’t it rather risky though?
